body: @clebertsuconic updating pull request with a couple of resized versions of those two.
@mtaylor @clebertsuconic Any updates on logo?

@milapbhojak I'm preparing the vote thread.. it was a holiday in US yesterday...
I'm planning to start the vote on next monday.
@clebertsuconic Okay, Thanks. Can I submit one more submission before Monday?

@milapbhojak is it a variation of the ones you posted earlier? if it's a variation (color / size.. ) I would ask you to do it today / tomorrow..  as I will have some issues with the form.

if it's a totally new one... it would be ok.
@clebertsuconic It's totally new, I can submit in next few hours. Is it fine?
@milapbhojak that would be great!
Sure thing.  Thanks @clebertsuconic
@mtaylor  congratulations BTW! 👍

This was the second place on the votes... it was a strong submissions...

I have no words to express you thank you.. even though you weren't selected on this submission, this helped quite a lot...

I own you a lunch if we ever meet on the same conference :)
@mtaylor congrats!!!
Excellent work @mtaylor - congratulations!
Hey @clebertsuconic Thanks a lot, Which one got selected? Would like to know :)
would it be possible to add a unit test?
I've added a test using Mockito to exemplify the conditions under which the out of order issue is verified.

The changes seem fine, need to squash this commit into one commit to make it less confusing.  Also it might be good to remove the colon following the AMQ-6808 as that seems like it has broken the JIRA integration so the updates to the PR aren't showing up in ActiveMQ JIRA.

We're looking to release 5.15.1 relatively soon (next week or so) if you want this in the next release can you either A. Squash the commits, or B. Close and create a new clean version with the final changes?  Otherwise it won't see a release for awhile.
I've squashed the commits, removed the colon and pushed again, hope it works out!

It can be easily configured with below. Hence closing pull request as fix is not necessary.
<bean id="postgresPersistenceAdapter" class="org.apache.activemq.store.jdbc.adapter.PostgresqlJDBCAdapter" >
<property name="acksPkName" value="local_activemq_acks_pkey"/>
</bean>

It is not my day today. The link is wrong, it should of course be [Qpid Proton API](https://qpid.apache.org/proton/index.html).

I think though, what kills this push request is PROTON-1585 - in that it looks like the end of the proton messenger API, or at least its promotion. I'm grateful to have been told about this though, so at least something positive has come out of this experience.

I also think it would be best to remove the python AMQP example as well.

OK - I've changed my mind after all, and produced a python proton reactor example. In the end, to me, it kind of felt wrong not having one.

Please let me know what / if anything I need to change.

And thanks for your feedback.
First thing to do is to rebase against master and then squash your commits into one, right now the history in the PR is a bit messy

I've tried running the new samples but so far I didn't have any luck, the readme steps don't seem to work, I get an error on the 'pip install' bit when it hits the proton stage, and the pytest bits don't work as they complain about invalid command line args such as the '--flake8' option.  The original example on master while not working real well for me does still manage to send and receive some messages.
Retest this please

Thanks for pushing things further & sorry you encountered a problem

I admit I am surprised - I wasn't expecting anything like this. Live and learn.

If your able to send me a https://gist.github.com/, or a comment here in git, of what pip said then it will help me investigate further. At the moment it looks like it might be an environment problem, possibly some photon dependencies that screwed up the pip install.

In the meantime I've updated the readme to try and be more helpful; rebased off master; squashed my commits & pushed.

Would be nice if I could just run the example via the standard  'python sender.py' as the old ones worked but that just seems to do nothing either with or without a broker running.  

Some output from the pip install:

> Collecting pytest==3.2.2 (from -r requirements.txt (line 20))
>   Using cached pytest-3.2.2-py2.py3-none-any.whl
> Collecting pytest-cov==2.5.1 (from -r requirements.txt (line 21))
>   Using cached pytest_cov-2.5.1-py2.py3-none-any.whl
> Collecting pytest-flake8==0.8.1 (from -r requirements.txt (line 22))
>   Using cached pytest_flake8-0.8.1-py2.py3-none-any.whl
> Collecting pytest-ordering==0.5 (from -r requirements.txt (line 23))
>   Using cached pytest_ordering-0.5-py2.py3-none-any.whl
> Collecting python-qpid-proton==0.17.0 (from -r requirements.txt (line 24))
>   Using cached python-qpid-proton-0.17.0.tar.gz
>     Complete output from command python setup.py egg_info:
>     Traceback (most recent call last):
>       File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
>     ImportError: No module named setuptools
>     
>     ----------------------------------------
> Command "python setup.py egg_info" failed with error code 1 in /tmp/pip-build-mR5kGQ/python-qpid-proton/
> You are using pip version 8.1.1, however version 9.0.1 is available.
> You should consider upgrading via the 'pip install --upgrade pip' command.
> 

I've already got proton installed so really don't want it messing about with my installation anyway

I'm pretty sure that it's a local environment issue: your python environment can't build python-qpid-proton.

I'm saying this as I created a simple travis evironment, using the same requirements.txt, that seems to prove it: https://travis-ci.org/jameshnsears/activemq/builds/287164818

If you open up one of the travis build jobs from that link, look at the Raw log (I used pip -vv, so tonnes of logging I'm afraid) you can search for "python setup.py egg_info", then at the end of the Raw log you can see what "pip list" says. There's a load of _cproton.so compiling between these two points.

What do you think?

I can remove all this requirements.txt related stuff (modify the readme) and go back to two, or three, simple python files. I can assume that whomever is running these files has an environment that contains a pre-built compatabile python-qpid-proton. I can live with that.

What would you like me to do?

I don't have an issue in general with the setup script, I just can't validate it works.  As for the others I mainly can't tell if they are working, when I run the sender and receiver they print nothing regardless of there being a broker running or not so there's no feedback.  With the original examples they produce output to indicate that the sender has sent 10k messages, and the receiver oddly reads only 1k or them hehe.

I've simplified the code, rebased & squashed it. The integration test has gone (and all that pytest stuff). You can now test the code as before - simply by running the examples. The readme has links to dependency instillation. Best of all, the examples print messages out!

Please give it a go and let me know how it looks :-)

FWIW I also see the same thing as above, running against proton master which will shortly become 0.18.0. I did a run with -v for verbose output which suggested maybe the issue is in the 'config' file, or how its used, but alas I know next to nothing about python and am unsure how to further identify and fix whatever the issue is.

OK - I've pushed a fix. I was able to reproduce the problem on an upto date debian python 2.7.13.

As sugguested it was to do with the "config.py" file - it was being imported into the "receiver.py" file and brought in with it the import "from proton import Message". 

The same original code (and the new code) works just fine on my python 3.5.3. And also worked just fine in an ubuntu travis environment that, amongst 4 different python versions, also featured 2.7.13. Maybe it's the way python 2..7.13 has been built? Or maybe it's what SWIG (the C to python library) outputs. I don't know.

It's been an interesting lesson if nothing else :-D

Let me know if you need me to do anything else. And thanks for your time.

I see the same error on cleanup of "content" when running the 'sender.py' bit as that still pulls in the content bit via the import.  I'm trying now to rebuild my proton install from upstream to see if that helps at all

My machine has python 2.7.12 installed

I found three things worth noting.

First, the TypeError that Tim saw looks like a Proton bug to do with a relatively recent change in object lifecycle.  For me, it does not occur if I construct the messages in the same package (as opposed to in content.py).  Worth noting that is annoying but harmless.  It's some faulty error handling in a destructor that only occurs on shutdown.

Second, I don't understand the redelivery stuff in the second run of the receiver.  It looks to me like the redelivery accounting on the broker is weird.  I'm not finding anything wrong on the client ends.  Here's what I get in a protocol trace from the receiver side.

  https://gist.github.com/ssorj/cd098c3f7054da39752f6c1ead75bc28

Last, I modified the receiver program to shutdown more cleanly (avoid going back into on_message during close).

  https://gist.github.com/ssorj/cf94cc306ceea30850feb0035d506bb1

Justin - the broker I've been using is ActiveMQ 5.15.0

I'll update the receiver.py with your improvements (it showed my lack of understanding of the api). I'm not tied to any broker, as this effort is only for a pet project of mine.

I'll try things out with 5.15.1, and another broker (qpid or maybe Artemis). I'll post some feedback tomorrow.

Thanks for your help :-)

Thanks for looking @ssorj that helps.  So if we get those changes into the samples then I think we can go ahead and merge this.  The delivery count bit is interesting but seemingly unrelated at this point to the examples.  That's something we could dig into in another issue, I'm not sure right now what is triggering it to behave that way.  At fist I thought it could be a bug in the lastDeliveredSequenceId tracking bits in the broker side session handler but given that the last message arrives without a delivery count I'm a bit stumped at the moment on what is going on.
I raised https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PROTON-1634 for the TypeError output.

I've fetched; rebased; applied @ssorj's patch; squashed and pushed.

Out of interest I ran the sender and receiver against artemis-2.3.0 & don't see the issue I see in activemq-5.15.0 or activemq-5.15.1

Let me know if I need to do anything else. Thanks everyone for the help.
I see that these are minor changes, but at this volume it still takes a bit to review.

Hello Hadrian,

I understand completely. If I can help in any way, let me know.

Daniel
Use the user mailing list / user forum to ask for help. Close this invalid PR please!
This should have been accepted a long time ago. Looks good, testing and merging shortly.

I think the contribution is good, but I am conflicted because I dread the if/then/else programming that crept up in parts of activemq. I am not referring to your if, but to conditional logic that's topology aware (i.e. master-slave). What if it's a full-mesh or star topology? On the other hand, your patch addresses an issue with code from the pre-nob era.

I think I'll give it a whirl tomorrow and apply the patch from 5.14.x up (reluctantly).

I wouldn't hold my breath for Jenkins to validate this.

I like your patch. Chris gave another solution of achieving the same result. There is another one, less direct that what Chris pointed at, but your solution is cleaner. What I don't like about your patch is that it doesn't address the by far most common way of configuring a broker, which is xml. Without that this patch is not very useful.

Maybe you can add that too, or I will try to find some time for that. I do get the usefulness of your patch, if would allow for different forwarding strategies in larger nobs, such as different paths for small vs large messages, or priorities, or whatever.

I am honestly not sure how one (I) could fix conflict and merge this one. Unfortunately it diverged too much from official branches. If you could clean-up and resubmit (maybe create a jira and assign it to me?) Otherwise it looks like it'll just be closed/ignored.
Didn't fully review, looks good, but sooo many files changed (plus one conflict). I'll try to find the time to review, but it won't be easy. Thanks for the contribution!
Sounds like a valid patch, or at least a valid concern. I cannot find your actual patch in the haystack of other commits. Can you please help with a bit of cleanup or point me in the right direction?

I've reorganised logic and now it is possible to set up bridge factory per network connector. It is injectable property so it can be created as regular bean within spring/blueprint xml and reused across multiple connectors giving opportunity to have more advanced configurations of bridge factory implementations.
'working' is not a very expressive variable name, but good patch. Many thanks!
Not sure why github didn't close this automatically. Please feel free to close.
Isn't this applied already? I'll take a look tomorrow and apply it if not already done. Simple patch, looks good, thanks for the contribution!

I expected something easier to configure, with less xml elements using FactoryFinder, not injection, not a big IoC fan.

However it works, ran tests. Merging for now, we can improve later if necessary.
Wouldn’t be better to replace by a log.debig or Info instead ?
It left there accidently. If logging will be added, then it could be using proper logger

I want ask a question? how to run the test case in activemq-leveldb-store.
Or can you tell me how to run it. Thank you

I am not familiar with this project that much, but tried with
mvn -Dtest=IndexRebuildTest test 
and it ran single test case. It seems to be maven project so instruction in http://maven.apache.org/surefire/maven-surefire-plugin/examples/single-test.html might work.

Good patch, except that the version is too old. Fixed the code using a more recent version. This PR is similar to #75, you get the credit though too. Many thanks for the contribution.
Good patch, except that the version is too old. Fixed the code using a more recent version. This PR is similar to #75, you get the credit though too. Many thanks for the contribution.

Asutosh

@cshannon unfortunately the current implementation of this feature simply doesn't scale, with a large number of consumers and producers the broker is prone to running out of memory. See https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMQ-6940
Any reviews on this PR?
The build check is faulty.  Local build passed.  Commit merged with thanks to Alvin Lin.

@thisthat Good catch! That should happen if `Long::MAX_VALUE` or any "big" timeout value would be used, please can you add some tests covering those cases ie requesting a deadline that overflow?
Obviously, where is possible to add some :+1:
@franz1981  I've added some tests that cover some of those classes ;)

Umm... I understand some of the reasons in the features.xml, but I don't understand why you are creating a new activemq-client-osgi jar.    The only difference between it and the current activemq-client jar seems to be the embedding of the hawtbuf classes.   All the other imports and everything seem to be the same (ish, some of the ranges are missing).      I don't see the point of that so would be -1 to creating another bundle for that.   HOWEVER, I would definitely be ok with updating the OSGi manifest in the current client jar to mark things as optional if they are optional and updating the features.xml to reflect that.

Yes, there is only 2 differences with activemq-client:
1. Embedded hawtbuf
2. Corrected OSGI imports (optionals and version ranges)
I think that building super-bundles is project approach. I can modify pull request by shading hawtbuf dependency and modify OSGI headers in activemq-client module.

This looks like a good fix. But https://activemq.apache.org/stomp.html actually publicly state that you can set `activemq.dispatchAsync` to `true|false`. Are we ok to break this "backward compatibility"?
@alvinlin123 - The doc will need to get updated.
Updating my fork and will re PR

The error report is Jenkins not being able to clone the repo? 
Not sure whom to reach out to look into the Jenkin issue..
retest this please

The Jenkins PR job can not fetch the repo to perform a test. 
Whom has perms / access to fix the Jenkins job?

@tadamski the CI link no longer works but I suspect the issue might be that the patch changes the getter from `boolean` to `Boolean` but the setter keeps using `boolean`.

This might lead to an issue as this does not comply with the JavaBeans specification to identity properties.
Jenkins error is the git reset hard issue, not the patch contents itself.

@jmesnil - I have updated the fix so that both getter and setter use Boolean but still got errors that seem to me a problem with Jenkins configuration:
